author.name: Gareth Field
author.summary: a trail runner, developer, coffee lover, and dog dad based out of beautiful downtown New London, Connecticut!

markdownRemark.excerpt: Good morning! Okay, so I think I’ve got the flow of  back, I’m going to just rely on devs being able to generate a token and bring it back to the terminal…
markdownRemark.html:
Good morning!

Okay, so I think I’ve got the flow of master-blaster back, I’m going to just rely on devs being able to generate a token and bring it back to the terminal … hopefully they can do it, hopefully this is still faster than going through 60 repos one by one, hopefully this lowers the barrier to changing branches from master to main or whatever, let’s go! Then when I run out of energy later I’ve got some hardware stuff to do! Yay!

New machine is great, btw, though I’m having a hard time using the right-click function on the trackpad, and it’s running a little hot. No WONDER, though, how did they get a whole computer in here?! It’s TINY!

Ok go go go!

//

Ahhhh, I’m not used to python environment stuff yet! I ran pipenv install -e . and pipenv shell, and then I was able to run master-blaster … eep though.

//

Hey, this is going pretty smoothly now! Yay for libraries! Yay for questionary!

frontmatter.title: Blastin Off Again
frontmatter.description: In which Gareth says okay to the GitHub API ...

frontmatter.title: Oh, He Said (I Need To Write Docccumentation For This!)
